thread.title: Twitter Is Freaking Out About That *Moonlight* and *La La Land* Best Picture Mix Up at the 2017 Oscars
thread.title_full: Twitter Is Freaking Out About That *Moonlight* and *La La Land* Best Picture Mix Up at the 2017 Oscars

title: Twitter Is Freaking Out About That *Moonlight* and *La La Land* Best Picture Mix Up at the 2017 Oscars
text:
Facebook PHOTO: MARK RALSTON 
As you've surely heard by now, Moonlight won Best Picture at the 2017 Oscars...even though La La Land was first announced as the winner. The major mixup made us super grateful for live television (unless you, like Chris Rosa , were in the bathroom when it happened and had to listen to me scream, "CHRIS! CHRIS! IT WAS MOONLIGHT ! GET OUT HERE!") 
But listen, this snafu was not Best Picture award presenters Warren Beatty and Faye Dunaway's fault. As you can plainly see, someone gave them the envelope with Emma Stone's Best Actress win in it. Beatty read " La La Land "—and even double-checked it with Dunaway because he was confused—and ended up concluding that the only movie title on the card must be the winner. Honestly? Understandable. 
See the evidence here:
